What is lotto?
Buying a sequence of numbers for a very small chance to win big price money.
What is "responsible gambling"?
Setting limits on time/money to avoid addiction.
What is the downside of "Martingale" betting strategy?
Doubling bets after losses will increase bets too high, just for chance to break even.
What is a "tell" in card games?
A subcouscious clue that gives away a player's hand strength
What differs a cash game from tournaments in poker?
cash games plays with real money without limit, tournaments has fixed buy-in for final prizes.
What's the "flop" in poker?
The first 3 community cards dealt face up
What's the best possible hand in poker?
Royal flush, (10 to Ace straight of the same suit)
What is a bomb in Big 2?
Four of a kind, beats all but higher bombs
What is the suit order in Big 2?
Clubs - Diamond - Heart - Spades (weak to strong)
What does "ko" mean in Go?
No immediate recapture a stone that leads to endless loop
Where did Go originate from?
China, as WeiQi, over 2500 years ago
What are two sizes of Go board?
Small 9x9, normal 19x19 grid
What is "komi"?
Bonus points, usually 6.5 to 7.5, given to white to balance Black's first move advantage
How are points scored in Go?
Empty controlled territory + captured stones
What is the most popular non-competitive adult board game?
Dungeons & Dragons
Which game has players act out words without speaking?
Charades
When can one double on standard Black Jack rule?
When one has two cards to the total of 9, 10, 11
What is the highest-value card in Blackjack?
Ace as 11
What type of game is Gwent?
Deckbuilder
List all the different playable factions in Gwent.
Northern Realms / Nilfgaard / Scoia'tael / Monsters / Skellige
What weather card in Gwent disables siege row?
Torrential Rain
What is the fifth taste?
Xian, or Umami, the savory taste found in soy sauce, seafood, etc
Why do people still collect vinyl?
Usually they prefer the warmer, raw sound of vinyl, compared to the crisp but shallower digital sound.
What is the difference between hobby and a side hustle?
A hobby is for fun, a side hustle is for money
What is the use of a bobber(float) in fishing?
To suspend bait/hook at a set depth, and detect bites
What do we use to store fishing gear?
a tackle box
List the 5 most basic components of fishing gear
hook / bait / weights / reel / rod
Wind and brass instruments work similarly, but what are the differences?
Woodwind: blowing or vibrating a reed, soft and mellow, requires finger dexterity, fast and intricate melodies / Brass: buzzing lips, louder, sustained notes, breath control
What is the single most important setting in photography?
Aperture, how much light is let in, which also affects depth of field
What is universal accepted single most demanding and expensive hobby in the world?
relationship with a woman
